p: The occurrence of anti-Chikungunya IgM antibodies was 10.39% and was higher in females, 10.80% (19/176) than males 9.52% (8/84) with no association between gender and IgM seropositivity ( p = 0.924). Though there was no statistical significance between age and IgM seropositivity ( p = 0.508), subjects within the age group (21–40) years recorded sero-prevalence of 12.90% more than any other age group.
